question: Seawater is saltier than rain water due to which of the following reasons?
option1: Sea beds have salt producing mines
option2: Rivers wash away salts from the earth and pour them into sea
option3: The air around sea is saltish
answer: Rivers wash away salts from the earth and pour them into sea
explanation: After years and years of river inflow and evaporation rivers wash away salts from the earth and pour them into sea. The salt content of the river water built up to the present levels. The same process made the seas salty. Rivers carry dissolved salts to the ocean. Water evaporates from the oceans to fall again as rain and to feed the rivers, but the salts remain in the ocean.
